Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: jucuska
Reviews.Content: i was here on business..horrible accommodation. I had a THEFT in my room. Hotel did nothing about it. If it was an item of more value I would've gone after them. Low budget, poorly maintained, not very clean, smelly, hotel didn't even have a workout facility. I do not recommend this to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great inexpensive room”
Reviews.Author: voyage_a_varadero
Reviews.Content: Booked the room with a third party site. Saved a few $$ and got no problem checking in. Even got an upgrade from a queen to a king room, sofa and work table. Bathroom small but just ok. Room was clean, smelled fresh. Asked for a quiet corner and I got a quiet corner. Very happy with service and all. Directly infront of the second largest shopping mall in montreal. Subway station on the opposite side of the street.

Reviews.Title: “I wanted my money back.”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on New Year's Eve, December 31, 2011. The reason for the stay is that I live in downtown Montreal and wanted to spend the night somewhere quieter away from all the excitement. I rated my stay so low because the buzzing coming from the big electric station directly next to the side of the hotel where my room was located was so loud I didn't sleep a wink and I was wearing earplugs. Yes, it was that loud! To be fair I do have sensitive hearing, but while watching TV I had to turn the volume to the highest setting to hear it over the noise. I complained to the receptionist who came up to my room and told me he couldn't hear anything. Are you kidding??!! He offered to move me to another room but unfortunately none were free on the other side of the hotel. So, I tossed and turned all night before calling it quits and checking out at 5:30am. My ears were actually aching, and I couldn't leave fast enough. The hotel was nice enough in most other aspects. The hotel was practically right next door to the metro - super convenient. Free parking and free wireless internet were also perks. Just make sure to ask to stay on the street side of the hotel in order to avoid the buzzing problem. And you'll have to bring your own fan for white noise during the winter as the AC unit that also includes the fan is turned off.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, for the price.”
Reviews.Author: brittany f
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend I just got back from this hotel. We stayed from Friday December 30th,2011 to Sunday January 1, 2012. The hotel is located about 15 minute drive from downtown. We arrived at about 4pm and since we were tired we just decided to eat near the hotel and do some shopping. Directly across the street there is a sports bar, "Le Cage Aux Sport" ... excellent food. There is a large,well known mall attached to the bar . IT IS HUGE. Seeing as boxing day had just passed, we found lots of deals :) . Saturday evening we ate dinner at the restaurant in the lobby, it was surprisingly the best food we had eaten throughout our entire trip. Although the standard rooms arent anything fancy, they were comfortable for the amount of time we actually spent in our room. if you are unsure as to getting downtown, turn left out of the parking lot of the hotel& follow that street (sherbrooke) all the way down . University street has underground parking and it a 2 minute walk to the entrance for the underground city. The largest underground shopping center.

Reviews.Title: “Netheir Royal nor Prince but average”
Reviews.Author: Torontonian54
Reviews.Content: The name Royal Versailles is certainly misleading. Forgo any expectations of sumptuous amenities and be willing to accept decent lodging comfort in a very good location, east of the city centre. The included continental breakfast is a welcome touch. But you will never meet Marie-Antoinette here.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad; indifferent unprofessional stuff.”
Reviews.Author: Elena_And
Reviews.Content: The rooms are old, paint falls off in some places. There is a sewage problem - the room was stinking. The stuff didn't seem to know anything beyond where the rooms are located. They didn't have a map of Montreal (what hotel wouldn't have a map of their city for tourists???!!!), didn't know the number of the lobby!!! The waitresses in the restaurant didn't give us instructions as to how the coupons worked, didn't provide a good service. The worst was how they dealt with my noise complaint. We were unlucky enough to have booked our stay at the same time as a bunch of American teenagers did. That's an issue in nature. They were so loud all night long! And the little security couldn't help, he just told me that they were "children". Like I care who makes the noise! So the second of the two nights I couldn't sleep at all. When we were checking out, other people were complaining about the noise too. Beware, normal people!!! As for the "night animals" and wild crowds, this hotel is all that you need ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good stay”
Reviews.Author: SilverDartLodgeWes
Reviews.Content: Easy to find, just off highway. Great location - walking distance to mall / restaurants. Service was just okay - may have been a language barrier. Room was clean with updated comfortable furnishings. Ate at restaurant for breakfast, was average at best. Close to Biodome - a "must do" in Montreal if you have little ones! Overall would recommend because of location, cleanliness, and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly fine, polite staff,clean room..............Val Caron On.”
Reviews.Author: oscarlisa
Reviews.Content: We had no problem at all, the location is great,the room are clean, continental breakfast was better then expected. As a matter of fact hope they have rooms available for the new year I plan to stay there again...........all depend on your expectation as good as if not better then comfort inn.................

Reviews.Title: “Not to Shabby”
Reviews.Author: schmidta31
Reviews.Content: I think I would stay here again, definitely. When you first walk in the lobby is very nice. Our room really needed new carpet. I really didn't like walking on it without shoes on. The pool areas was nice, although it was too chilly to actually swim. Breakfast could have been better. Cold cereals and dry pastries. There were 2 toasters to make toast, but there was a really long wait. The front desk staff were excellent, even had them call and order our pizza for us because I was unsure wheather the pizza place employees spoke english. Wasn't the best place I have ever stayed, but I would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: traveler1004
Reviews.Content: They say it's well located wich is true... BUT... some one broke into my car, normal thing says the front desk! happens all the time... as for the rooms, eventhough i got a non smoking room it smelled like an ash tray. For 20$ or so, you could book downtown in somewhere nicer!

Reviews.Title: “Not "Royal" at all”
Reviews.Author: RayRuffell
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a non-smoking room - (aren't they all suppose to be now?) but the smell of old cigarette smoke was so strong it was overwhelming. Front desk staff was friendly and the location is very handy to the Metro and the Versailles Plaza Mall. The price was very reasonable and we were with a boys sports team so there were lots of large lounge areas for the group to assemble. All the clothes and the suitcases came home stinking like smoke - they really need to steam clean/deodorie the entire place. Some of the interior rooms had no windows at all, other rooms had windows that could not be opened. The breakfast was $5.00 and consisted of prepackaged pastries and basic box cereals and some apples.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to book an event”
Reviews.Author: breezagirl
Reviews.Content: I booked a conference room for my book launch at this hotel, and I was not disappointed. The room was ready when I arrived and the staff courteous and very helpful. I had many boxes to unload, and I had a staff member who assisted me. Whatever I requested, I was given. I was allowed to bring my own food, which was a bonus for me. The evening turned out very successful and my guests were pleased with the location (lots of parking too) and the spacious surroundings. Thanks Royal Versailles for helping to make my book launch a memorable day for me! Laura Fabiani, author of Daughter of Mine

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel...if you don't mind cigarette smoke”
Reviews.Author: miltontraveller
Reviews.Content: Hotel location was great, right on Metro. Rooms were clean and functional.... typical hotel rooms. Problem was with the smell of cigarette smoke. We were in a non-smoking room but it had obviously been smoked in, and the windows didn't open to let in air. Asked to be moved but no rooms were available. The front desk said they would put a machine in to clear the air but it didn't work. Front desk staff were very pleasant but did not always follow through on what they promised. I'm not a picky traveller but the smell of smoke made it difficult to sleep. I could even smell it on all the clothes in my suitcase. It made what would have been a great stay for the price, into an uncomfortable visit. I would recommend this place if you are a smoker or don't mind the smell of smoke. Others in our group had a similar problems in their non-smoking rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Rate”
Reviews.Author: ezzie3
Reviews.Content: Great location - close to the metro and on a major road. Very nice staff. Felt completely comfortable speaking English and French. Free parking. Hotel price was excellent. Hotel lobbies are very nice. Free wireless internet, but you have to register with the front desk. Views from the rooms are not great (while I enjoyed watching cars on Rue Sherbrooke at night, the other options are a parking lot and a powerplant, I believe). Tub drain didn't drain. Hotel restaurant was decent, a bit overpriced, and often crowded by large business groups, but there's a mall nearby with decent restaurants. (I recommend Mike's in particular). As a warning, the Harvey's across the street made me homesick for a McDonald's hamburger - and I've never had *that* feeling before.

Reviews.Title: “A nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sebastianesc
Reviews.Content: I've also stayed in Montreal before, at both the downtown Delta and at the Maritime Hotel and found this place really not too bad. When I read that it was only 2 star it made me worry about what ''hole in the wall'' my family was going to be staying at but I was pleasantly surprised with my stay at the Royal Versailles. We had no problem with the room, bed sizes or the room service, and even though the room wasn't perfect [wallpaper was split at the seam in one spot and the bathroom roof had a hole in the plaster] it wasn't as though it was a complete nightmare. We stayed two nights there and they really weren't all that bad, and if you want a nice view, ask for a room overlooking the swimming pool [just look at my view]. Plus, I traveled here with my 73 year old father who had a stroke in Nov. of 2005 and found it more than convenient for him to walk about while we stayed here. Now we never had a chance to eat at the restaurant so I can't offer an opinion on the food or service offered there but I wasn't terribly disappointed with the Royal Versailles Hotel and I'd recommend it to some one who'd like a simple stay and save a few $$$ at a nice little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never going back”
Reviews.Author: rickis01
Reviews.Content: Usually, paying about 200 bucks per night should fetch us something decent, courteous and relaxing. Instead, we paid the money and received unknowledgeable staff who did not even know the general info surrounding the tourist industry (eg, is the Metro strike over), were not welcoming and shrugged off problems associated with the suite, itself (eg, light on the night-table did not work, etc). They misrepresented the style of the breakfast, did not close important info about Internet access and did not mention that local calls were 44 cents plus tax until asked outright. They had no general booklet type info about restaurants around the hotel, etc and insisted that we can order in-house (yeah, right). We have seen this type of info available in many other hotel rooms (comparable rating) as a courtousy. We have traveled long and hard many many times...to Montreal and have stayed at several different hotels. I guess next time, if there is no room available in our favourite hotels, we just stay put and don't bother...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect like Canada in General!”
Reviews.Author: AlanLamart
Reviews.Content: Hi My wife and I went to Canada last year for the first time, we came in Toronto, Niagara Falls and Montreal. We are French from the suburb of Paris. All the hotels and services were good but we had a quite perfect experience in the "Royal Versailles" in Montreal. I worked years ago in the business of Hotelery and I know what I can expect as service from a hotel considering its category and I was nicely surprised in this hotel. People were so nice to us. We had no problems. Rooms were very clean and no problems of maintenance. What I appreciated the most was the hospitility at our arrival. Next time we come we'll book this hotel before leaving France! Alan LAMART

Reviews.Title: “Dirty room”
Reviews.Author: simbafreya
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and the best thing I can say about the hotel is it has plenty of parking. Upon entering the hotel I was impressed as the lobby is large and bright. When we entered the corridor to our room I noticed a smoky musty smell. Our room had not been cleaned. There were no towels at all in the bathroom. The side table by the window had a sticky patch on it, the dressing table had some sticky red liquid on it. the carpet was badly stained with a large white stain. I lifted back the bedspread and blanket to find the bottom sheet was not tucked under the mattress and was badly wrinkled as were the pillow cases. One pillow contained loose irregular shaped foam pieces, like a bag of rags. I went to the front desk and told them I believed the room had not been cleaned and the sheets had not been changed from the last guest. The receptionist said this was not the case. He gave us some towels. No apology.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of the power station....but close to the metro”
Reviews.Author: nokidsathome
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online (web special) to attend the Jazz Festival 2006. This was not our first choice but it was what was available in our price range. From the moment we checked in things went downhill. The room was not what we wanted but what was given to us on the web. When I asked to change the room after check in I was told to ask in the morning and there would be rooms available. At 9am I went to the front desk only to be told that nothing was available....I left my room number in hopes that things would change. I don't really believe there was any attempt to accomadate our request. We attempted to eat dinner that evening in the dinning room only to find out that there was a wedding and the restaurant was closed. We were told we could eat at the bar but it would take an hour for anything to be prepared. We finally decided to get on the metro (which is right next door) and head downtown and eat. We came back later that night to the bar for a drink and found that the bartender was not at the bar but out at the pool drinking and smoking weed with the wedding guests. The next evening we tried to stop in again and get something quick to eat and it was finally explained to us that the restaurant is not even open to hotel guests on the weekend because of events. We were told that the front desk is not made aware of this and there was never a sign that stated this. The "web special" includes a view of the power station, double beds (instead of queen), old TV and stand. When we passed by open rooms they seemed better appointed than the one we were assigned. Pros: The breakfast was reasonable and the morning waitstaff was great. Close to the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Lobby was great, rooms, not so much. The rooms are small and kind of musty smelling. Parking is free though. Breakfast was overpriced and overcooked, restaurant is not good at all, but you can go to the mall for meals. Beds are TERRIBLE, and the pillows were maybe an inch thick. Overall, not the best money I've ever spent, but it was close to where I needed to be. Will not stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Royal Versailles Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 7200 Sherbrooke St. East, Montreal, Quebec H1N 1E7, Canada (Formerly Hotel Wandlyn)
